comment: Controlling the center.
The queen's gambit. If Black plays 2... dxc4 White will eventually win back the pawn.
The classical way to decline the gambit.
Developing and putting pressure on d5.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6
comment: Developing and defending d5.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5
comment: Pinning the knight and putting more pressure on d5. Pillsbury was the first to demonstrate this is the best move.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7
comment: Breaking the pin.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O
comment: Getting the king out of the center.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6
comment: The bishop will be developed on b7.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3
comment: White's pieces are actively placed.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5
comment: White must not delay this move or Black will play dxc4 and his bishop will be very active. The recommended move now is 8... Nxd5 followed by 9. Bxe7 Qxe7 10. Nxd5 exd5. Black avoids 10... Bxd5 because of 11. e4 and White would control the center.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5
comment: Knights placed in center squares are very powerful.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. f4
comment: This provides strong support for the knight and opens the way for a kingside attack.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. f4 c5
comment: It is correct to try to undermine the powerful knight by attacking its defenders.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. f4 c5 11. O-O c4
comment: A strategic error: Black relieves the tension in the center. Black's queenside attack is no match for White's kingside attack."

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. f4 c5 11. O-O c4 12. Bc2 a6

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. f4 c5 11. O-O c4 12. Bc2 a6 13. Qf3 b5 14. Qh3
comment: Threatening 15. Nxd7 Qxd7 (if 15... Nxd7 then Qxh7#) 16. Bxh7+ Kh8 (If 16... Nxh7 17. Qxd7) 17. Bf5+ Kg8 18. Bxd7. If Black plays 14... h6 then 15. Bxh6 gxh6 16. Qxh6 Ne4 17. Rf3 Bf6 18. Rg3+ Nxg3 19. Qh7#.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. f4 c5 11. O-O c4 12. Bc2 a6 13. Qf3 b5 14. Qh3 g6 15. f5
comment: To exchange pawns and open the file for the rook on f1.

comment: Black counterattacks on the queenside.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Nf3 b6 7. Bd3 Bb7 8. cxd5 exd5 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. f4 c5 11. O-O c4 12. Bc2 a6 13. Qf3 b5 14. Qh3 g6 15. f5 b4 16. fxg6
comment: If 16... bxc3 then 17. Bxf6 Nxf6 18. Rxf6 fxg6 (Not 18... Bxf6 19. Qxh7#) 19. Bxg6 $1 hxg6 20. Rxg6#. If instead 16... fxg6 then 17. Qe6+ Kh8 18. Nxd7 Nxd7 (If 18... Qxd7 then 19. Bxf6+ wins the queen) 19. Bxe7 wins a piece.
